interior.title: Interior
interior.description: Expandable acoustic panels for walls and ceilings. Perfect for offices, restaurants, and public spaces.
interior.fullDescription: Our Interior panels are designed for seamless integration into any space. Made from 100% recycled textiles, they offer exceptional sound absorption while adding visual warmth to your environment.

solid.title: Solid
solid.description: Minimal, high-density panels for maximum acoustic performance. Ideal for demanding environments.
solid.fullDescription: Solid panels combine minimalist aesthetics with maximum acoustic performance. Their high-density construction makes them perfect for spaces requiring superior sound control.

divide.title: Divide
divide.description: Freestanding acoustic dividers for flexible space management. Mobile and modular.
divide.fullDescription: Divide offers flexible space management with freestanding acoustic panels. Perfect for open offices, they can be easily moved and reconfigured as your needs change.

rwood-groove.title: rWood - Groove
rwood-groove.description: Premium acoustic wood panels with natural oak and walnut veneers. Elegant design meets superior sound absorption.
rwood-groove.fullDescription: rWood - Groove panels combine the natural beauty of FSC-certified wood with exceptional acoustic performance. Featuring precision-milled grooves and integrated felt backing, these panels transform any space with warmth and style while delivering Class A sound absorption.

rpet-groove.title: rPET - Groove
rpet-groove.description: Sustainable grooved acoustic panels made from recycled PET. Modern aesthetics with excellent acoustic performance.
rpet-groove.fullDescription: rPET - Groove panels feature a distinctive linear pattern created from 100% recycled PET bottles. The grooved design maximizes sound absorption while adding contemporary texture to walls and ceilings.

rpet-panel.title: rPET - Panel
rpet-panel.description: Versatile recycled PET acoustic panels. Clean design for walls and ceilings with superior sound control.
rpet-panel.fullDescription: rPET - Panel offers a clean, minimal aesthetic crafted entirely from recycled PET bottles. These versatile panels provide excellent acoustic performance for any interior application.

rpet-circle.title: rPET - Circle
rpet-circle.description: Circular acoustic ceiling elements made from recycled PET. Create visual interest while improving acoustics.
rpet-circle.fullDescription: rPET - Circle brings a unique design element to ceiling acoustics. These circular panels, made from recycled PET, create striking visual compositions while effectively controlling sound reverberation.

rpet-divide.title: rPET - Divide
rpet-divide.description: Freestanding acoustic dividers made from recycled PET. Flexible space management with sustainable materials.
rpet-divide.fullDescription: rPET - Divide combines the flexibility of freestanding dividers with sustainable recycled PET construction. Perfect for creating adaptable workspaces and privacy zones in open environments.

story.title: From Waste to Wonder
story.paragraph1: Re-Sound was born from a simple question: what if we could transform the mountains of textile waste into something beautiful and useful?
story.paragraph2: Founded in Belgium in 2021, we set out to create acoustic panels that perform as well as traditional products while being 100% circular.
story.paragraph3: Today, we've diverted tons of textiles from landfills and created acoustic solutions for hundreds of spaces across Europe.

circular-economy-acoustics.title: The Circular Economy: A New Era for Acoustic Solutions
circular-economy-acoustics.excerpt: How circular design principles are transforming the acoustic panel industry and why it matters for the future.

content.intro: The acoustic panel industry is undergoing a fundamental transformation. Traditional linear modelsâ€”take, make, disposeâ€”are giving way to circular approaches that keep materials in use indefinitely.

section1.title: Why Circularity Matters
section1.text: Every year, millions of tons of acoustic materials end up in landfills. These materials, often containing synthetic fibers and adhesives, can take centuries to decompose. The circular economy offers an alternative: designing products that can be continuously recycled.

section2.title: Our Approach
section2.text: At Re-Sound, we've designed our panels from the ground up for circularity. Using only recycled textiles and bio-based binders, our panels can be fully recycled at end of lifeâ€”becoming new panels rather than waste.

content.quote: The best acoustic panel is one that never becomes waste.

section3.title: The Business Case
section3.text: Circular design isn't just good for the environmentâ€”it's good business. By creating value from waste and offering take-back programs, we build stronger relationships with customers while reducing material costs.

conclusion.title: Looking Forward
conclusion.text: The transition to circular acoustics is just beginning. As more companies adopt these principles, we'll see an industry transformedâ€”one where acoustic comfort and environmental responsibility go hand in hand.

office-acoustic-solutions.title: Creating the Perfect Acoustic Environment in Modern Offices
office-acoustic-solutions.excerpt: Practical tips for improving acoustics in open-plan offices, meeting rooms, and collaborative spaces.

content.intro: Open-plan offices present unique acoustic challenges. Without proper treatment, noise levels can reduce productivity by up to 66%. Here's how to create a balanced acoustic environment.

section1.title: Understanding Office Acoustics
section1.text: Sound in offices comes from multiple sources: speech, equipment, HVAC systems, and external noise. Effective acoustic design addresses all these elements.

section2.title: Strategic Panel Placement
section2.text: Not all surfaces need treatment. Focus on ceiling areas above workstations, walls between collaborative and focused zones, and dividers between desks.

content.quote: Good acoustics is invisibleâ€”you only notice when it's missing.

section3.title: Balancing Absorption and Reflection
section3.text: Complete absorption creates an unnaturally 'dead' space. The goal is reducing reverberation while maintaining some natural ambience.

conclusion.title: Start Small, Measure Results
conclusion.text: Begin with high-impact areas and measure the difference. Often, strategic placement of a few panels can transform a space.

recycled-materials-quality.title: Recycled Materials: Meeting and Exceeding Quality Standards
recycled-materials-quality.excerpt: How we ensure our recycled textile panels match or exceed the performance of traditional materials.

content.intro: There's a persistent myth that recycled materials mean compromised quality. Our panels prove the oppositeâ€”recycled can mean superior.

section1.title: Rigorous Material Selection
section1.text: Not all recycled textiles are suitable for acoustic panels. We carefully select and sort materials to ensure consistent fiber quality and acoustic performance.

section2.title: Advanced Processing
section2.text: Our proprietary processing transforms mixed textiles into uniform acoustic fiber. This consistency is key to achieving predictable, high-performance results.

content.quote: Sustainability and quality aren't trade-offsâ€”they're complements.

section3.title: Third-Party Testing
section3.text: Every batch undergoes acoustic testing to EN ISO 354 standards. We achieve Class A absorption ratings consistently, meeting the same standards as virgin material panels.

conclusion.title: The Future is Recycled
conclusion.text: As processing technology improves, recycled materials will increasingly outperform virgin alternatives. The question isn't whether to use recycledâ€”it's how quickly we can scale.

sound-absorption-explained.title: Sound Absorption Explained: A Guide for Architects
sound-absorption-explained.excerpt: Everything you need to know about sound absorption coefficients and selecting the right panels.

content.intro: Understanding acoustic specifications can be challenging. This guide breaks down the key metrics and what they mean for your project.

section1.title: The Î±w Coefficient
section1.text: The weighted sound absorption coefficient (Î±w) is the most common metric. It ranges from 0 (no absorption) to 1 (complete absorption). Our panels achieve Î±w 0.95-1.00.

section2.title: Frequency Considerations
section2.text: Different materials absorb different frequencies. Porous materials like ours excel at mid and high frequenciesâ€”the speech rangeâ€”making them ideal for offices.

content.quote: The right absorption depends on the room's purpose.

section3.title: Coverage Calculations
section3.text: More isn't always better. The ideal coverage depends on room volume, surface materials, and intended use. We offer free acoustic consultations to help specify correctly.

conclusion.title: Beyond the Numbers
conclusion.text: While specifications matter, the best acoustic design considers the whole experience. Aesthetics, sustainability, and wellbeing all contribute to successful spaces.
